Suppose a hypothesis test will be used to investigate whether the proportion of United States adults who have been a victim of a cybercrime, such as identity theft, is greater than <math alttext="0.25" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.25</mn></math>. Suppose that the hypothesis test is conducted using a significance level of <math alttext="0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.05</mn></math> and the power of the test is determined for a specific alternative value using the significance level of <math alttext="0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.05</mn></math>.
If the significance level of the hypothesis test is changed to <math alttext="0.01" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.01</mn></math> and the power of the test is computed for the same alternative value using a significance level of <math alttext="0.01" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.01</mn></math>, which of the following best describes the change(s) to the probability of a Type <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>I</mtext></math> error and the power of the test?
